meanings.definition: A dead body, especially of a human being.
meanings.sent1: The graveyard was filled with corpses of fallen soldiers.
meanings.sent2: The authorities arrived to investigate the discovery of several corpses in the abandoned building.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie had so many corpses that it became comical.
meanings.sent4: The battlefield was littered with corpses, a stark reminder of the brutality of war.
meanings.sent5: The stench of decaying corpses hung heavy in the air.

meanings.sent1: The morgue was overwhelmed with corpses after the tragic accident.
meanings.sent2: The mass graves contained countless corpses from the natural disaster.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house was filled with fake corpses that startled visitors.
meanings.sent4: The battlefield was a sea of corpses, a chilling sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed ancient Egyptian tombs with mummified corpses inside.

meanings.definition: The remains of something that has been destroyed or broken up.
meanings.sent1: The abandoned factory was now just a shell with corpses of machinery scattered around.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologists uncovered the corpses of an ancient civilization buried beneath the ruins.
meanings.sent3: The broken vase lay in pieces, its shards like corpses of its former self.
meanings.sent4: The shattered dreams left behind were like emotional corpses haunting her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The burnt forest was a landscape of charred corpses of trees.
